MemoryInfobox.name: The Beggar's Fate
MemoryInfobox.description: 'Upon being framed (so he claims) for the destruction of a shrine, one man lost his citizenship to Athens, and was determined to have revenge.'

General_Description: '''The Beggar's Fate''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s [[Genetic memory|genetic memories]], relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: A beggar tasked Kassandra with killing the man who framed him.
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra talked to a beggar in the market.
*'''Kassandra:''' Chaire''. Anything you need a [[mercenary]]'s help with?''
*'''Man:''' ''[[Athens]] has abandoned me, ''misthios''. I was accused of trying to destroy a shrine, and now I have nothing. I have lost my citizenship.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''That's a harsh punishment.''
*'''Man:''' ''I was framed! Now, I wish I had destroyed it. Or at least had my revenge on the man that framed me.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You want me to kill him.''
[[File:ACOD-TheBeggarsFate-02.jpg|thumb|250px|Kassandra killing the official]]
*'''Man:''' ''Yes. His death is the only answer.''
(Accept – I'll handle it)
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You can count on me.''
*'''Man:''' ''It's time someone showed me mercy.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I'll be back when everything's taken care of.''
Kassandra found and killed the official, then returned to the beggar.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Your man is dead.''
*'''Man:''' ''Thank you. For everything. Please, this isn't much, but take it.''
Section_Outcome: Kassandra killed the official alleged to have framed a man for desecrating a shrine.
Section_References:
*''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]''
